I've been off work for 11mths now so I started to pop into work to help build my confidence before starting on a phased return. I was greeted by the person covering my role who said when are you returning to work because I've taken your role and there's not room for two of us. She said that she'd put a lot of work into it while I've been off and wasn't willing to stand aside. It didn't register with with me until I got home what had been said. All that weekend I felt very low and scared about going back to work. After thinking about it for days on end I called my manager and reported what had been said. I'm so glad I called because she said it was a temp step up until my return. We'll I'm never going to have to work with her again because I've just found out I'm being made redundant. Posts.Content: Hi guys, I've read lots of posts regarding weight gain especially ladies on tamoxifen. I'm not sure if it's available everywhere or whether its a post code lottery? But in the summer I was told I needed to lose 2 stone to be able to have reconstruction. After dieting a month and thinking I hadn't lost any weight I went to my GP. ( I had lost it was my bathroom scales not working lol) But she gave me a card for a health trainer, which I phoned and got an appointment the very next day. She gave me a voucher for 12 FREE sessions for slimmers world ( can also get them for weight watchers) It's helped me enormously and I'm 3& half pounds away from my target. I know how hard it is so any little help we can get GO for it! Also after being off work for so long cost is an issue!! I hope this helps good luck k

Posts.Title: I had my first cry today

Posts.Content: hello, can anyone help me? I need a rant and advice.  I underwent lots of tests last year before my hospital would even refer me to the plastic surgeon. A CT scan showed cysts on my liver and just to be sure I was sent for another CT scan then an MRI after mounths of waiting it was confirmed it was cysts.  To cut a long story short I was told to lose two stone then go back to plastic surgeon. I lost weight by end October and waited months to see the surgeon again.  Anyway I was finally given a date for DEIP reconstruction 15th April ( as part of the pre-op) I was given another CT scan ( here we go again) CT scan showed up something again!!! Grrrrrrrrr  Operation was cancelled and was told I needed an altra sound scan. Had scan they are still not sure!! Grrrrrrrr So I saw my original surgeon who did my mastectomy and who had ordered all the scans last year ( He was not happy!!!)  He said all they needed to do was call him and he would have sent over a copy of all the scans ( which he then did) He also wasn't happy about my tamoxifen being stopped.  Well I get a call 10days later with a new date 13th May saying they were happy to go ahead all scans matched ( this yrs and last)  yeah I thought!!  But last Friday we started a four day break in the Lake District before operation only to get a call from the hospital saying they was cancelling my op again because my LIVER grrrrrrrrr. We had just ordered food in pub and the call made me feel sooooo sick I didn't eat my food. They are NOW saying scans don't match and this is something new on my liver!!  I called my BCN left message--- she called me back to say she was leaving for the day and there would be an MDT meeting this week about me. Does this mean it's something to worry about???? When we reached the lodge I had no phone signal and there was no internet. Omg!!!! I got in my car ( bumped my car into a post) more Grrrrrrr drove until I got signal.  I spoke to a lovely Macmillan nurse who advised me to speak to pals.  I can't tell you the power and comfort of this site ( but couldn't access it all weekend)  Does anyone know what test is going to show what's up with my liver???????  Besause im fed up!!!!!! a biopsy????  They keep telling me different things until the point I no longer trust them! I'm soooo stressed what should have been a lovely weekend -- turned into me feeling sick, having pains attacks with my lips going numb and not being able to think of anything else.  So sorry to rant when I know so many of you are going through this hell! Cancer! please has anyone got any answers???? Love karan

Posts.Title: Good news!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey, I swim every week and only use my protheseies from the hospital and I find it's fine it doesn't move!! I'm very lucky that my local swimming baths have a post surgery swim every Tuesday for ladies only. I look forward to it because it's the only exercise I get. So be brave and go for it once you have tried it you'll want to keep going!! Best wishes k
Posts.Title: Swimming with prosthesis

Posts.Content: In April I was told I needed a ct scan before I would be referred for reconstruction. So I had my 1st ct scan on 28th April, never heard anything but did get a letter to see the plastic surgeon so I just thought everything must have been ok. The night before seeing the plastic surgeon the BCN phoned me to say you need to have another ct scan of my liver because they think I have cysts on my liver? I had this scan two weeks ago. Today I thought I would call the hospital to see if my results were back? Only to be told that I now need an MRI on my liver for a more detailed look.I asked the BCN is it only cysts ? And she said yes. But why on earth do I need an MRI if they say it's only cysts???? I'm now feeling a little emotional thinking oh no what if it isn't? Has anyone else had this happen? 99% of the time I'm very positive but it's that 1% today has got me! Thz k
Posts.Title: In need of some reassuring words!

Posts.Content: Thank you for your replies, it's been my hubby's birthday today and we have been into wales for day to see our eldest daughter ( it was so lovely to see her she's such a breath of fresh air) it's taken my mind off things most of the day but those nagging what ifs did creep into my head from time to time. The main thing is my hubby has had a lovely birthday! I'm going to have to wait and see. I'm a little scared and you all know how that feels!! Love to you all k
Posts.Title: In need of some reassuring words!

Posts.Content: Hi katie, welcome to the club no one wants to be a member of!!! I'm out the other side now and feeling good! I finished treatment in February 2014. Tips I picked up along the way ----paint your nails dark to protect them from the light and it helps stop them from falling off! Make sure you take any anti- sickness tablets given to you. ( also try ginger biscuits) they help with feeling sick. Be very carefully in the sun ( take cover in this heat) your skin will be more sensitive to the sun. The hospital will give you a mouth wash to help with the mouth ulcers.(actually the hospital called it my party bag ) it was full of meds to help with most things--- indigestion, sickness, constipation, you name it it was in there lol! And if it isn't ask there's always something to help with the side effects! Accept all offers of help from friends & family as they like to feel they are helping in some way.And most important REST when you need to!! I hope this helps a little. Wishing you and your sister all the best for your treatment k
